P0123.title: Throttle/Pedal Position Sensor/Switch 'A' Circuit High
P0123.summary: The ECU is seeing a throttle position sensor (TPS) or pedal position signal higher than expected. [These fault_codes are not actual codes and were generated by ChatGPT to test tooling.]
common_causes: TPS wiring fault (open circuit, short to 5V)
safe_checks: Inspect connector and wiring for damage/corrosion
Verify 5V reference and signal voltage range with ignition on
Check ECU fault log / runtime values for TPS

P0102.title: Mass or Volume Air Flow Circuit Low Input
P0102.summary: The ECU is seeing a MAF signal lower than expected. [These fault_codes are not actual codes and were generated by ChatGPT to test tooling.]
safe_checks: Confirm sensor is connected and pinned correctly
Check sensor setup matches installed hardware
